metadata.Title: CVE-2022-22825 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
lookup in xmlparse.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.3 has an integer overflow.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-22825` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.4.3-1
libexpat1 - 2.4.3-1
No subscription required

firefox - 1:1snap1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> paraview uses system expat xotcl uses system expat poco uses system expat gdcm uses system expat audacity uses system expat simgear uses system expat coin3 uses system expat as of 4.0.0~CMake~6f54f1602475+ds1-1 sitecopy uses system expat since 1:0.16.0-1 (dapper!) leosilva> CVE-2022-22822 to CVE-2022-22827 has the same fix/patch.

criterions.comment: cadaver package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
expat package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.3-1').
firefox package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1snap1-0ubuntu1').
libxmltok package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
matanza package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu1').
wbxml2 package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
xmlrpc-c package in lunar is affected and may need fixing.
